Lasagna Verde

This recipe is a little more work than the standard lasagna, but is well worth the time involved!

 

Ragu:

1/2 c butter

2 carrots finely chopped

2 celery stalks finely chopped 

1 onion finely chopped

1lb lean ground beef

1/2 lb lean ground veal

 2 c water

1/4 c tomato paste

1 c dry red wine

 

TO MAKE:  Melt butter in large saucepan over medium high heat.  Add carrots, celery, and onion.  Cook until soft, stirring often about 8 minutes.  Add beef and veal.  Cook until meats are cooked through, about 5 minutes.  Whisk 2 cups water and tomato paste in small bowl.  Add to meat mixture.  Bring to boil; reduce heat to medium and simmer 5 minutes.  Add wine.  Bring to boil, then reduce heat to medium.  Simmer until almost all liquid has evaporated, stirring occasionally, about 1 hour.  Season with salt and pepper.  Can be made 3 days ahead.  Keep refrigerated.

 

Bechamel

5 tbs butter

5 tbs all purpose flour

2 1/2 c whole milk

 

 TO MAKE:  Melt butter in large saucepan over mdium heat.  Add flour and cook 3 minutes, stirring frequently. Gradually whisk in milk.  Whisk until thickened, about 5 minutes.  Can be made 1 day ahead.  Keep refrigerated.

 

Lasagna

1 lb spinach lasagna noodles

1 1/4 c freshly grated Parmesan cheese

 

 TO MAKE:  Preheat oven to 400 F.  Cook lasagna noodles in boiling salted water until tender but stlll firm to bite.  Drain and rinse under cold water.  Butter bottom and sides of glass baking dish.  Cover bottom of dish with noodles.  Speard 1/2 cup bechamel over noodles.  Spread 1 cup ragu over bechamel.  Sprinkle with 1/4 cup Parmesan.  Repeat 3 more times with noodles, bechamel, ragu and cheese.  Top with layer or noodles spead remaining bechamel over and sprinkly with remailing cheese.   Can be made 8 hours ahead.

Bake lasagna until bubbling at edges and golden, about 30 minutes.  Let stand 10 minutes before serving. 

Meanwhile, pour enough olive oil into heavy large saucepan to reach depth of 2 inches.  Heat oil over medium heat to 375 F.  Line baking sheet with paper towels.  Working in small batches, place spinach leaves in hot oil (spinach will splatter).  Fry spinach leaves 20 seconds.  Using slotted spoon, transfer fried spinach to prepared baking sheet.  Top lasagna with spinach and serve.
